alert.note: Alert for Chester; Delaware (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued June 26 at 7:38PM EDT until June 26 at 10:45PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1045 PM EDT THIS EVENING FOR NORTHWESTERN NEW CASTLE, SOUTHEASTERN CHESTER, AND SOUTHWESTERN DELAWARE COUNTIES... At 738 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms produced between 1 and 2 inches of rain across the warned area. Rain has tapered off. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets, and underpasses as well as other drainage and low lying areas. Some locations that may experience flash flooding include... Wilmington, Elsmere, Kennett Square, New Castle, Newport, Greenville, Ashland, Stanton, Hockessin, Pike Creek, Talleyville, and Wilmington Manor. This includes the following highways... Interstate 95 in Delaware between mile markers 4 and 16. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around...don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
